page.title: 05A Shawforth Farrier
page.content:
Mr. C. Thompson has been a farrier in Shawforth for 10-12 years. He became a farrier because he was very interested in horses. He has travelled as far away as North Wales shoeing horses.
He also likes being a farrier because he enjoys working with hot metal. Mr. Thompson makes his shoes by heating a piece of metal in a forge and putting it over the anvil. He hits it with a hammer and bends it to the correct shape.
Next he puts holes in it for the nails to go through. The shoe is then plunged into cold water. If somebody wants the shoe on hot he burns it onto the horse's hoof.
